responses.response:
Todd Achilles is an American politician, technology executive, U.S. Army veteran, and educator who served as an Idaho State Representative for District 16B from February 2024 until resigning on July 1, 2025, to run for U.S. Senate in 2026 as an independent.
ballotpedia+1
​

Early Life and Education

Raised on a family farm in Oregon, he holds a B.A. in economics and international relations from Claremont McKenna College, an M.B.A. and M.A. in international studies from the University of Washington, and an M.P.A. from UC Berkeley.
justfacts.votesmart+1
​

Career Highlights

Achilles served as a tank platoon leader in the U.S. Army (1992-1995), then advanced to executive roles at T-Mobile, HTC, HP, and as CEO of Evoca (2017-2022). He holds technology patents and co-founded Veterans for Idaho Voters.
linkedin+1
​

Political Service

Appointed by Governor Brad Little to replace Colin Nash, he won re-election as a Democrat in November 2024 (59.8% of vote) before resigning due to frustration with the two-party system, federal debt, wars, and public lands issues. He teaches public policy at Boise State University and UC Berkeley.
localnews8+4
​
Mar 31, 2025 — Todd Achilles serves as an Idaho State Representative and minority caucus chair. He teaches innovation, strategy, antimonopoly, and policy analysis at GSPP.Read more
